Constructor Detail

QVDWriter

public QVDWriter(java.lang.Boolean useCache,
                 java.lang.String fileName,
                 java.lang.String tableName,
                 int limitRecords,
                 java.lang.String defNumberFormat,
                 char decimalSeparator,
                 char groupingSeparator,
                 java.lang.String defDateFormat,
                 java.lang.String defDateTimeFormat,
                 java.lang.String[] fieldNames,
                 java.lang.String[] fieldTypes,
                 java.lang.String[] fieldFormats)
Creates QVDWriter instance

Parameters:
useCache - if true, disk is used to cache QVD symbols, use for large QVD files and smaller memory footprint (performamce trade-off)
fileName - QVD file name to create
tableName - Table name of the data
limitRecords - limit amount of records written to QVD file
defNumberFormat - default DecimalFormat pattern, e.g. '#,###,##0.00' (patterns are non local)
decimalSeparator - default decimal separator, sets the character used for decimal sign, e.g. ',' for European locals
groupingSeparator - default grouping separator, sets the character used for thousands separator, e.g. '.' for European locals
defDateFormat - default date format e.g. 'dd.MM.yyyy' for European locals
defDateTimeFormat - default datetime format e.g. 'dd.MM.yyyy HH:mm:ss' for European locals
fieldNames - QVD field names as String array
fieldTypes - QVD field types as String array (optinal), possible field types: TEXT, NUMBER (QlikView's dual type, e.g. formatted decimal), INT (signed integer), REAL (decimal, double or float), DATE, DATETIME
fieldFormats - QVD field formats as String array (optinal), e.g. Java DecimalFormat pattern '#0.0' for NUMBER or SimpleDateFormat 'MM/dd/yyyy' for DATE

set field types of QVD table

Parameters:

public void setFieldFormats(java.lang.String[] strFieldFormats)
set field formats of QVD table

Parameters:
strFieldFormats - QVD field formats as String array, e.g. Java DecimalFormat pattern '#0.0' for NUMBER or SimpleDateFormat 'MM/dd/yyyy' for DATE
